contextId.information: This refers to the eternal nature of Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: I am the first and the last

contextId.information: This means everywhere: the place where God and the angels live, the place where people and animals live, and the place where those who have died are. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: in heaven or on the earth or under the earth

contextId.information: his means everywhere: the place where God and the angels live, the place where people and animals live, and the place where those who have died are. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:05:03|5:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: in heaven and on the earth and under the earth

contextId.information: These two parts of the day are used to refer to all of the time. AT: "ever"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
These three phrases share similar meanings and emphasize that Jesus has and will exist for all time. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]]).
contextId.quote: the alpha and the omega, the first and the last, the beginning and the end
